alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 4:13PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN CIBOLA AND NORTHWESTERN VALENCIA COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Acoma Pueblo, or 17 miles south of Laguna Pueblo, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Laguna Pueblo, Acoma Pueblo, Cubero, Mesita, Skyline-Ganipa, New Laguna, San Fidel, Seama, Acomita and Paraje. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 98 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains
